item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Tides for Middletown starting with May 7, 2008.

Day High Tide Height Sunrise Moon Time % Moon
/Low Time Feet Sunset Visible

W 7 High 2:43 AM 3.2 5:39 AM Rise 6:53 AM 3
7 Low 10:17 AM -0.4 7:55 PM Set 11:13 PM
7 High 3:17 PM 2.3
7 Low 10:12 PM 0.0

Ok this area has worked last year for us quite a few times on trips on the metabassette and from trips returning from the ocean when it was raining for a simple barbie q..etc

I want to use this as a launch point for the evening..go up the CT river then to the Cog...

but we have to get going close to 6 to make it up and back before dark..

the trip involves Play around in the Cog till the sun is getting 45 or so minutes ready to set..then head back to the Weslean boat ramp for a simple dinner.

I will cook something..not sure what yet..but will use the little barbie q...

Ok getting to the Weslean boat ramp...

From Hartford: Points North of Middletown via Route 9 South:

Take exit 14. (Dekovan) Make 3 consecutive lefts (off of exit left on Dekoven, left on Union, then left on Harbor ) and the WESLEAN boat ramp (ITS BEFORE the Harbor Park Restaurant) is on the right.
You may have to park wherever you can because the drunks go to the harbor rest...so look around..but you can drop off your boat by the boat ramp before parking..

From Points South of Middletown via Route 9 North:
Take Exit 12. At first stop sign go straight. At second stop sign go left. At first stop light go right and at first stop light again go right. Go under overpass and bear left. WESLEAN boat ramp (BEFORE Harbor Park Restaurant) is on your right.

From Points North of Middletown via I-91 South:
Take Exit 22S. This puts you on route 9 south. Follow directions from 9 South.

From Points South of Middletown via I-91 North:
Take Exit 22S. This puts you on route 9 south. Follow directions from 9 South.

For Mapquest or GPS just use 80 Harbor Drive Middletown CT to get you close enough..
compare your directions to mine..

If you need a kayak..let me know which one....or your skill level and i choose one..
item.how_to_find_us: I will have my Toyota Avalon and a Boat Trailer for my kayaks in the vicinity of the ramp area or my orange cones near us.. (may have to park in the dirt or paved area..dont know yet) Unloading by the ramp though.
item.why: Excersize and seeing a different part of the river we rarely get to..

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Kayak trip up the Cogandchug River in Middletown
